Platform.Title: Agilent QBiC 8 x 60k E.coli K-12 Expression Ver.1

Sample.Title: Parent strain_rep1

Channel.Source: Exponential culture of the parent strain without antibiotic
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: One hundred eighty uL of exponential cultures were withdrawn rapidly, and cells were killed immediately by the addition of an equal volume of ice-cold ethanol that contained 10% (w/v) phenol. The cells were collected by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4 °C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at −80 °C prior to RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Precultures were prepared by shaking -80 °C glycerol stocked parent and evolved resistant strains in 200 uL of modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates for 23 h at 34 °C without antibiotic. The cells precultured were diluted to an OD600 nm of 1 × 10^-4 into 200 uL of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates. Then, cultures were grown with shaking at 34 °C to an OD600 in the 0.072 ~ 0.135 range (equivalent of 10 generations).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated and purified from cells using an RNeasy micro kit with on-column DNA digestion (Qiagen) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of 9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: One hundred ng of purified total RNAs was labeled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Parent_replicate1
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Expression levels were normalized using the quantile normalization.

Sample.Title: Amikacin (AMK) resistant strain_Line1

Channel.Source: Exponential culture of AMK resistant strain Line1
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: One hundred eighty uL of exponential cultures were withdrawn rapidly, and cells were killed immediately by the addition of an equal volume of ice-cold ethanol that contained 10% (w/v) phenol. The cells were collected by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4 °C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at −80 °C prior to RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Precultures were prepared by shaking -80 °C glycerol stocked parent and evolved resistant strains in 200 uL of modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates for 23 h at 34 °C without antibiotic. The cells precultured were diluted to an OD600 nm of 1 × 10^-4 into 200 uL of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates. Then, cultures were grown with shaking at 34 °C to an OD600 in the 0.072 ~ 0.135 range (equivalent of 10 generations).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated and purified from cells using an RNeasy micro kit with on-column DNA digestion (Qiagen) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of 9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: One hundred ng of purified total RNAs was labeled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: AMK1
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Expression levels were normalized using the quantile normalization.

Channel.Source: Exponential culture of DOXY resistant strain Line3
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: One hundred eighty uL of exponential cultures were withdrawn rapidly, and cells were killed immediately by the addition of an equal volume of ice-cold ethanol that contained 10% (w/v) phenol. The cells were collected by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4 °C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at −80 °C prior to RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Precultures were prepared by shaking -80 °C glycerol stocked parent and evolved resistant strains in 200 uL of modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates for 23 h at 34 °C without antibiotic. The cells precultured were diluted to an OD600 nm of 1 × 10^-4 into 200 uL of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates. Then, cultures were grown with shaking at 34 °C to an OD600 in the 0.072 ~ 0.135 range (equivalent of 10 generations).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated and purified from cells using an RNeasy micro kit with on-column DNA digestion (Qiagen) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of 9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: One hundred ng of purified total RNAs was labeled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: DOXY3
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Expression levels were normalized using the quantile normalization.

Sample.Title: Trimethoprim (TP) resistant strain_Line1

Channel.Source: Exponential culture of TP resistant strain Line1
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: One hundred eighty uL of exponential cultures were withdrawn rapidly, and cells were killed immediately by the addition of an equal volume of ice-cold ethanol that contained 10% (w/v) phenol. The cells were collected by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4 °C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at −80 °C prior to RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Precultures were prepared by shaking -80 °C glycerol stocked parent and evolved resistant strains in 200 uL of modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates for 23 h at 34 °C without antibiotic. The cells precultured were diluted to an OD600 nm of 1 × 10^-4 into 200 uL of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates. Then, cultures were grown with shaking at 34 °C to an OD600 in the 0.072 ~ 0.135 range (equivalent of 10 generations).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated and purified from cells using an RNeasy micro kit with on-column DNA digestion (Qiagen) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of 9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: One hundred ng of purified total RNAs was labeled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: TP1
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Expression levels were normalized using the quantile normalization.

Sample.Title: Ciprofloxacin (CPFX) resistant strain_Line3

Channel.Source: Exponential culture of CPFX resistant strain Line3
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: One hundred eighty uL of exponential cultures were withdrawn rapidly, and cells were killed immediately by the addition of an equal volume of ice-cold ethanol that contained 10% (w/v) phenol. The cells were collected by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4 °C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at −80 °C prior to RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Precultures were prepared by shaking -80 °C glycerol stocked parent and evolved resistant strains in 200 uL of modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates for 23 h at 34 °C without antibiotic. The cells precultured were diluted to an OD600 nm of 1 × 10^-4 into 200 uL of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates. Then, cultures were grown with shaking at 34 °C to an OD600 in the 0.072 ~ 0.135 range (equivalent of 10 generations).
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated and purified from cells using an RNeasy micro kit with on-column DNA digestion (Qiagen) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of 9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: One hundred ng of purified total RNAs was labeled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: CPFX3
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Expression levels were normalized using the quantile normalization.

Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Transcriptome data of Parent with MG stress
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Transcriptome data of KCl resistant strain 4 without stress
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of 9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: One hundred ng of purified total RNAs was labeled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Transcriptome data of Metha resistant strain 1 without stress
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated and purified from cells using an RNeasy micro kit with on-column DNA digestion (Qiagen) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of 9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: One hundred ng of purified total RNAs was labeled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Transcriptome data of MG resistant strain 2 without stress
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

The cells were collected by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4 °C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at −80 °C prior to RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The cells were precultured for 60 hours under the same condition with the laboratory with or without the corresponding stressors. Then, 5×10e7 cells in the exponential growth phase were used to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated and purified from cells using an RNeasy micro kit with on-column DNA digestion (Qiagen) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of 9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: One hundred ng of purified total RNAs was labeled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Transcriptome data of CPC resistant strain 3 without stress
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Title: KCl4_S

Channel.Source: KCl resistant strain with KCl stress
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MDS42
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Exponential cultures were withdrawn rapidly, and cells were killed immediately by the addition of an equal volume of ice-cold ethanol that contained 10% (w/v) phenol. The cells were collected by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4 °C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at −80 °C prior to RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The cells were precultured for 60 hours under the same condition with the laboratory with or without the corresponding stressors. Then, 5×10e7 cells in the exponential growth phase were used to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated and purified from cells using an RNeasy micro kit with on-column DNA digestion (Qiagen) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of 9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: One hundred ng of purified total RNAs was labeled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Transcriptome data of SoCar resistant strain 4 with SoCar stress
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Channel.Growth-Protocol: The cells were precultured for 60 hours under the same condition with the laboratory with or without the corresponding stressors. Then, 5×10e7 cells in the exponential growth phase were used to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Total RNA was isolated and purified from cells using an RNeasy micro kit with on-column DNA digestion (Qiagen) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of 9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: One hundred ng of purified total RNAs was labeled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Transcriptome data of Mal resistant strain 5 with Mal stress
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Transcriptome data of Croton resistant strain 5 with Croton stress
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: One hundred ng of purified total RNAs was labeled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) in accordance with the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Transcriptome data of CPC resistant strain 1 with CPC stress
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Title: Parental strain, replicate1

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Exponentially growing cultures (OD600 of ~1; mid-exponential growth phase) grown in the modified M9 medium were harvested for total RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: MDS42 and the ΔrecA mutant cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 5 ml of modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultivated overnight at 34°C at 150 rpm. The overnight cultures were diluted to an OD600 of 0.1 into fresh modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultured.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Two volumes of RNA Protect bacterial reagent (Qiagen) were added directly to one volume of the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. The cells were harvested by centrifugation at 5,000×g for 10 min at 25°C, and total cellular RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Total RNA was treated with DNase I at room temperature for 15 min. The purified RNA samples were stores at – 80°C before microarray experiments. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of 8.4 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturers instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at mid-exponential growth phase
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at mid-exponential growth phase
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log10 normalized expression of ORF. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Title: 3-Amino-1,2,4- triazole (3.AT) evolved strain Line1

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 96-well microplates containing 200 µl of modified M9 medium without chemicals used for laboratory evolution and cultivated 24h at 34°C with agitation at 900 rotations/min. The precultures were diluted to an OD620 of 0.000033-0.0004 into 200 µl of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates and cultured. After 12 to 21 h incubation, the exponentially growing cultures (OD600 in the 0.072-0.135 range) were harvested for total RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: MDS42 and the evolved strains cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 5 ml of modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultivated overnight at 34°C at 150 rpm. The overnight cultures were diluted to an OD600 of 0.1 into fresh modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultured.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An equal volume of ice-cold ethanol containing 10% (w/v) phenol was added directly to the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. The cells were harvested by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4°C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at –80°C before RNA extraction. Total cellular RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The purified RNA samples were stores at – 80°C before microarray experiments. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturer's instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Title: 5-Fluorouracil (5.FU) evolved strain Line3

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 96-well microplates containing 200 µl of modified M9 medium without chemicals used for laboratory evolution and cultivated 24h at 34°C with agitation at 900 rotations/min. The precultures were diluted to an OD620 of 0.000033-0.0004 into 200 µl of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates and cultured. After 12 to 21 h incubation, the exponentially growing cultures (OD600 in the 0.072-0.135 range) were harvested for total RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: MDS42 and the evolved strains cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 5 ml of modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultivated overnight at 34°C at 150 rpm. The overnight cultures were diluted to an OD600 of 0.1 into fresh modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultured.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An equal volume of ice-cold ethanol containing 10% (w/v) phenol was added directly to the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. The cells were harvested by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4°C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at –80°C before RNA extraction. Total cellular RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The purified RNA samples were stores at – 80°C before microarray experiments. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturer's instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

After 12 to 21 h incubation, the exponentially growing cultures (OD600 in the 0.072-0.135 range) were harvested for total RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: MDS42 and the evolved strains cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 5 ml of modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultivated overnight at 34°C at 150 rpm. The overnight cultures were diluted to an OD600 of 0.1 into fresh modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultured.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An equal volume of ice-cold ethanol containing 10% (w/v) phenol was added directly to the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. The cells were harvested by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4°C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at –80°C before RNA extraction. Total cellular RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The purified RNA samples were stores at – 80°C before microarray experiments. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturer's instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturer's instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Title: Blasticidine S hydrochloride (BSD) evolved strain Line4

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 96-well microplates containing 200 µl of modified M9 medium without chemicals used for laboratory evolution and cultivated 24h at 34°C with agitation at 900 rotations/min. The precultures were diluted to an OD620 of 0.000033-0.0004 into 200 µl of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates and cultured. After 12 to 21 h incubation, the exponentially growing cultures (OD600 in the 0.072-0.135 range) were harvested for total RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: MDS42 and the evolved strains cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 5 ml of modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultivated overnight at 34°C at 150 rpm. The overnight cultures were diluted to an OD600 of 0.1 into fresh modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultured.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An equal volume of ice-cold ethanol containing 10% (w/v) phenol was added directly to the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. The cells were harvested by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4°C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at –80°C before RNA extraction. Total cellular RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The purified RNA samples were stores at – 80°C before microarray experiments. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.

Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Title: Carbenicillin Sodium Salt (CBPC) evolved strain Line3

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 96-well microplates containing 200 µl of modified M9 medium without chemicals used for laboratory evolution and cultivated 24h at 34°C with agitation at 900 rotations/min. The precultures were diluted to an OD620 of 0.000033-0.0004 into 200 µl of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates and cultured. After 12 to 21 h incubation, the exponentially growing cultures (OD600 in the 0.072-0.135 range) were harvested for total RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: MDS42 and the evolved strains cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 5 ml of modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultivated overnight at 34°C at 150 rpm. The overnight cultures were diluted to an OD600 of 0.1 into fresh modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultured.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An equal volume of ice-cold ethanol containing 10% (w/v) phenol was added directly to the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. The cells were harvested by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4°C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at –80°C before RNA extraction. Total cellular RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The purified RNA samples were stores at – 80°C before microarray experiments. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturer's instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Channel.Growth-Protocol: MDS42 and the evolved strains cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 5 ml of modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultivated overnight at 34°C at 150 rpm. The overnight cultures were diluted to an OD600 of 0.1 into fresh modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultured.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An equal volume of ice-cold ethanol containing 10% (w/v) phenol was added directly to the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. The cells were harvested by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4°C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at –80°C before RNA extraction. Total cellular RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The purified RNA samples were stores at – 80°C before microarray experiments. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturer's instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturer's instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Title: D-Valine (DVAL) evolved strain Line2

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 96-well microplates containing 200 µl of modified M9 medium without chemicals used for laboratory evolution and cultivated 24h at 34°C with agitation at 900 rotations/min. The precultures were diluted to an OD620 of 0.000033-0.0004 into 200 µl of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates and cultured. After 12 to 21 h incubation, the exponentially growing cultures (OD600 in the 0.072-0.135 range) were harvested for total RNA extraction.

Channel.Extract-Protocol: An equal volume of ice-cold ethanol containing 10% (w/v) phenol was added directly to the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Title: Erythromycin (EM) evolved strain Line1

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 96-well microplates containing 200 µl of modified M9 medium without chemicals used for laboratory evolution and cultivated 24h at 34°C with agitation at 900 rotations/min. The precultures were diluted to an OD620 of 0.000033-0.0004 into 200 µl of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates and cultured. After 12 to 21 h incubation, the exponentially growing cultures (OD600 in the 0.072-0.135 range) were harvested for total RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: MDS42 and the evolved strains cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 5 ml of modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultivated overnight at 34°C at 150 rpm. The overnight cultures were diluted to an OD600 of 0.1 into fresh modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultured.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An equal volume of ice-cold ethanol containing 10% (w/v) phenol was added directly to the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. The cells were harvested by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4°C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at –80°C before RNA extraction. Total cellular RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The purified RNA samples were stores at – 80°C before microarray experiments. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.

Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Title: Furaltadone (FTD) evolved strain Line3

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 96-well microplates containing 200 µl of modified M9 medium without chemicals used for laboratory evolution and cultivated 24h at 34°C with agitation at 900 rotations/min. The precultures were diluted to an OD620 of 0.000033-0.0004 into 200 µl of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates and cultured. After 12 to 21 h incubation, the exponentially growing cultures (OD600 in the 0.072-0.135 range) were harvested for total RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: MDS42 and the evolved strains cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 5 ml of modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultivated overnight at 34°C at 150 rpm. The overnight cultures were diluted to an OD600 of 0.1 into fresh modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultured.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An equal volume of ice-cold ethanol containing 10% (w/v) phenol was added directly to the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. The cells were harvested by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4°C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at –80°C before RNA extraction. Total cellular RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The purified RNA samples were stores at – 80°C before microarray experiments. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturer's instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Channel.Growth-Protocol: MDS42 and the evolved strains cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 5 ml of modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultivated overnight at 34°C at 150 rpm. The overnight cultures were diluted to an OD600 of 0.1 into fresh modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultured.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An equal volume of ice-cold ethanol containing 10% (w/v) phenol was added directly to the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. The cells were harvested by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4°C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at –80°C before RNA extraction. Total cellular RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The purified RNA samples were stores at – 80°C before microarray experiments. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturer's instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Channel.Label-Protocol: 100 ng of purified total RNA samples were labelled using the Low Input Quick Amp WT Labeling Kit (Agilent Technologies) with Cyanine3 (Cy3) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: After confirmation of yields (> 825 ng) and specific activities (> 15 pmol/μg) of the Cy3-labbeled cRNAs using NanoDrop ND-2000, 600 ng of Cy3-labelled cRNA was fragmented at 60°C for 30 minutes in a reaction volume of 25 ul containing 1x Agilent fragmentation buffer and 2x Agilent blocking agent following the manufacturer's instructions. On completion of the fragmentation reaction, 25 ul of 2x GE Hybridization Buffer HI-RPM was added to the fragmentation mixture and hybridized to custom designed the Agilent 8× 60K arrays for E. coli W3110, E.coli_K12_Expression_Ver.1, for 17 hours at 65°C in a rotating Agilent hybridization oven. After hybridization, microarrays were washed 1 minute at room temperature with GE Wash Buffer 1 (Agilent) and 1 minute with 37°C GE Wash buffer 2 (Agilent), then dried immediately.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slides were scanned immediately after washing on the Agilent SureScan Microarray Scanner (G4900DA) using one color scan setting for 8x60k array slides (AgilentG3_GX_1Color, Scan Area 61x21.6 mm, Scan resolution 5um, Dye channel is set to Green and Green PMT is set to 100%).
Sample.Description: Gene expression of E. coli cells at exponential growth phase.
Sample.Data-Processing: The scanned images were analyzed with Feature Extraction Software 10.7.3.1 (Agilent) using default parameters (protocol GE1_107_Sep09 and Grid: ExternalFullGEML_043017_D_F_20120907) to obtain background subtracted and spatially detrended Processed Signal intensities. ORF level expression was calculated by median value of all probes corresponding to each ORF.

Sample.Title: Potassium Tellurite (IV) (KTe) evolved strain Line3

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 96-well microplates containing 200 µl of modified M9 medium without chemicals used for laboratory evolution and cultivated 24h at 34°C with agitation at 900 rotations/min. The precultures were diluted to an OD620 of 0.000033-0.0004 into 200 µl of fresh modified M9 medium in 96-well microplates and cultured. After 12 to 21 h incubation, the exponentially growing cultures (OD600 in the 0.072-0.135 range) were harvested for total RNA extraction.
Channel.Growth-Protocol: MDS42 and the evolved strains cells were inoculated from the frozen glycerol stock into 5 ml of modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultivated overnight at 34°C at 150 rpm. The overnight cultures were diluted to an OD600 of 0.1 into fresh modified M9 medium in test tubes and cultured.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: An equal volume of ice-cold ethanol containing 10% (w/v) phenol was added directly to the exponentially growing cultures to stabilize cellular RNA. The cells were harvested by centrifugation at 20,000 × g at 4°C for 5 min, and the pelleted cells were stored at –80°C before RNA extraction. Total cellular RNA was isolated using the RNeasy Mini Kit (Qiagen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. The purified RNA samples were stores at – 80°C before microarray experiments. The quality of the purified RNA was evaluated using Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with an RNA 6000 Nano kit (Agilent Technologies). Only purified RNAs that had RIN (RNA integrity number) of9.0 or more were utilized. The purified RNAs were stored at −80°C prior to transcriptome analysis.
